rules: This is an HTTP-based Redis client optimized for serverless and edge environments
Never use TCP connections - always use the HTTP/REST API
Import from '@upstash/redis' for standard Node.js usage
Use Redis.fromEnv() to load UPSTASH_REDIS_REST_URL and UPSTASH_REDIS_REST_TOKEN from environment
All Redis commands return Promises - use async/await or .then() chains
Commands automatically parse responses to JavaScript types (strings, numbers, objects, arrays)
Use pipelines for batching multiple commands to reduce latency
Enable automatic retry with the 'retry' option when creating a client
Set custom timeouts with the 'timeout' option (default: 5000ms)
Use enableTelemetry: false to disable usage analytics
For rate limiting, use the @upstash/ratelimit package instead of manual implementations
Always handle errors with try/catch blocks or .catch() handlers
Use TypeScript for full type safety and autocomplete support
Connection pooling is handled automatically - no need to manage connections
Supports Redis 7.0 commands including JSON, search, and time series
